Committing fix for #441. Basically, the theme reads the site's locale and checks if the a css file with the same name as the locale exists; if it does, it returns the file name; if it doesn't, it returns false preventing the header from including a non-existing file. This is useful if a user would like to use an fr-fr locale for example, but wants to keep the theme images in English.

commit_list.message:
Committing fix for #441. Basically, the theme reads the site's locale and checks if the a css file with the same name as the locale exists; if it does, it returns the file name; if it doesn't, it returns false preventing the header from including a non-existing file. This is useful if a user would like to use an fr-fr locale for example, but wants to keep the theme images in English.

Put search keywords in search field if any is passed.
Unrelated but included in this commit is using a 'pointer' cursor for inactive themes thumbs.

Committing fix for #441. Basically, the theme reads the site's locale and checks if the a css file with the same name as the locale exists; if it does, it returns the file name; if it doesn't, it returns false preventing the header from including a non-existing file. This is useful if a user would like to use an fr-fr locale for example, but wants to keep the theme images in English.
